info.name: Rubrik - v5.0.0-p1 - INTERNAL REST API
info.description:
Copyright Â© 2017 Rubrik Inc.

# Introduction

This is the INTERNAL REST API for Rubrik. We don't guarantee support or backward compatibility. Use at your own risk.

# Changelog

 Revisions are listed with the most recent revision first.

 ### Changes to Internal API in Rubrik version 5.0
 ## Breaking changes:
 * Introduced a new `GET /cluster/{id}/ipv6` endpoint for getting all IPv6s
   configured on a specific or all network interfaces.
 * Introduced a new `PATCH /cluster/{id}/ipv6` endpoint for configuring IPv6s
   on a specific network interface for each nodes in cluster.
 * Removed `/user_notification` endpoints.
 * Added `rawName` field in `ArchivalLocationSummary`, which contains the
   raw name of the archival location.
 * Removed `shareType` from config field in PATCH /managedvolume request.
 * Changed `/cluster/me/ntp_server` endpoint to accept symmetric keys
   and the corresponding hashing algorithm.
 * Removed `/job/type/prune_job_instances` endpoint.
 * Removed `/kmip/configuration` endpoint.
 * Removed `/session/api_token` endpoint.
 * Added `subnet` field in `ManagedVolumeConfig`, which specifies an outgoing
   VLAN interface for a Rubrik node. This is a required value when creating a
   managed volume on a Rubrik node that has multiple VLAN interfaces.
 * Removed the `VolumeGroupVolumeSummary`, and replaced it with
   `HostVolumeSummary`.
 * Removed `volumeIdsIncludedInSnapshots` from `VolumeGroupDetail`.
 * Added new optional fields `mssqlCbtEnabled`, `mssqlCbtEffectiveStatus`,
   `mssqlCbtDriverInstalled`, `hostVfdEnabled` and `hostVfdDriverState` to
   GET /host/{id} response.
 * Responses for `/cluster/{id}/dns_nameserver` and
   `/cluster/{id}/dns_search_domain` changed to be array of strings.
 * Added new required field `language` in `UserPreferencesInfo` for
   GET /user/{id}/preferences and PATCH /user/{id}/preferences
 * Added new field `missedSnapshotTimeUnits` in `MissedSnapshot`
 * Removed `localStorage` and `archiveStorage` from `UnmanagedSnapshotSummary`
 * Moved the `Turn on or off a given AWS cloud instance` endpoint from PATCH of
   `/cloud_on/aws/instance` to PATCH of `/cloud_on/aws/instance/{id}/cloud_vm`.
   Also removed the `id` field from the definition of `CloudInstanceUpdate`.
 * Moved the `Turn on or off a given Azure cloud instance` endpoint from PATCH
   of `/cloud_on/azure/instance` to PATCH of 
   `/cloud_on/azure/instance/{id}/cloud_vm`. Also removed the `id` field from
   the definition of `CloudInstanceUpdate`.
 * Moved the `Delete a given AWS cloud instance` endpoint from DELETE of
   `/cloud_on/aws/instance/{id}` to DELETE of
   `/cloud_on/aws/instance/{id}/cloud_vm`.
 * Moved the `Delete a given Azure cloud instance` endpoint from DELETE of
   `/cloud_on/azure/instance/{id}` to DELETE of
   `/cloud_on/azure/instance/{id}/cloud_vm`.
 * Modified the existing endpoint DELETE `/cloud_on/aws/instance/{id}` to
   remove entry of a given AWS cloud instance instead of terminating the
   instance.
 * Modified the existing endpoint DELETE `/cloud_on/azure/instance/{id}` to
   remove entry of a given Azure cloud instance instead of terminating the
   instance.
 * Removed `/job/type/job-schedule_gc_job_start_time_now` endpoint. Use
   endpoint POST `/job/type/garbageCollection` to schedule a GC job to
   run now.
 * Removed `config` parameter from `/job/type/garbageCollection`
 * Added optional parameter `jobInstanceId` to `EventSummary`.
 * Added `jobInstanceId` as a new optional query parameter for
   GET /event_series/{id}/status endpoint.
 * Modified the endpoint GET /event_series/status to a POST and changed the
   input parameter to a request body of type `EventSeriesDetail`.
 * Modified the endpoint PATCH /replication/target/{id} to take a request body
   of type ReplicationTargetUpdate instead of ReplicationTargetDefinition.
 * Added Discovery EventType.
 * Added 'name' and deprecated 'hostname' in 'HostSummary' and 'HostDetail'
   response.
 * Added 'isDeleted' and deprecated 'isArchived' in MssqlDbReplica response.
 * Removed `GET /stats/cloud_storage` endpoint.
 * Removed DELETE /oracle/db/{id} endpoint to delete an Oracle database.

## Feature Additions/improvements:
 * Added GET /event/event_count-by-status to get job counts based on job status.
 * Added GET /event/event_count-by-job-type to get job counts based on job type.
 * Added GET /event_series endpoint to get all event series information.
 * Added 'oracleDatabase' to ManagedObjectDescendantCounts.
 * Introduced `POST /session/realm/{name}` endpoint to generate session
   tokens in the LDAP display name of {name}.
 * Added optional `storageClass` field to `ObjectStoreReaderConnectDefinition`
   to store `storageClass` field for the newly connected reader location.
 * Added optional `encryptionType` field to `ObjectStoreLocationSummary` to
   return encryption type used for an object store archival location.
 * Added a new endpoint POST /oracle/db/download/{snapshot_id} to download
   a particular snapshot (and corresponding logs) for Oracle.
 * Added optional 'ownerId' and 'reference' fields to
   '/managed_volume/{id}/begin_snapshot'
 * Added new endpoints regarding references to Managed Volumes, which track
   the processes writing to the Managed Volume.
   - GET '/managed_volume/{id}/snapshot/{snapshot_id}/reference/{reference_id}'
     PUT '/managed_volume/{id}/snapshot/{snapshot_id}/reference/{reference_id}'
     PATCH
     '/managed_volume/{id}/snapshot/{snapshot_id}/reference/{reference_id}'
     DELETE
     '/managed_volume/{id}/snapshot/{snapshot_id}/reference/{reference_id}'
     are the endpoints for viewing, adding, editing and deleting a Managed
     Volume snapshot reference respectively.
 * Added optional 'apiToken' and 'apiEndpoint' fields to NasConfig to support
   Pure FlashBlade devices.
 * Added optional `smbValidIps`, `smbDomainName` and `smbValidUsers` fields
   to `VolumeGroupMountSnapshotJobConfig` to support secure SMB.
 * Added optional 'smbDomainName', 'smbValidIps', 'smbValidUsers' fields to
   ManagedVolumeExportConfig to support secure SMB.
 * Added a new optional field 'oracleSysDbaUser' to /host/{id} POST endpoint
   during register host for setting the Oracle username for account with sysdba
   privileges on this host.
 * Added a new endpoint DELETE /smb/domain/{domain_name} to delete the
   SMB Domain.
 * Added a new endpoint POST /smb/domain/{domain_name}/join to configure
   SMB Domain.
 * Added a new optional filed 'oracleSysDbaUser' to /host/{id} endpoint for
   changing the Oracle username for account with sysdba privileges on this
   host.
 * Added a new endpoint POST /smb/enable_security to enable Live Mount
   security
 * Made the `numChannels` field in ManagedVolumeConfig optional.
 * Added `applicationTag` field to ManagedVolumeConfig to specify workload
   type for a managed volume.
 * Added Maintenance EventType
 * Added POST `/report/global_object` endpoint to directly query table data
   from GlobalObject based on ReportTableRequest
 * Added new API endpoint GET `/diagnostic/snappable/{id}` returns
   diagnostic information of all backup tasks of a snappable.
 * Added new API endpoint GET `/diagnostic/snappable/{id}/latest` returns
   diagnostic information of the most recent backup task of a snappable.
 * Added `shareType` field to ManagedVolumeSummary and ManagedVolumeDetail.
 * Added oracle instant recovery API to trigger instant recovery of a
   database
 * Added RAC, Oracle host and Oracle database fields to the the oracle
   hierarchy API
 * Added a new endpoint GET /smb/domain to get a list of discovered
   SMB domains in the environment.
 * Added a new endpoint GET /notification_setting to get all Notification
   Settings.
 * Added a new endpoint POST /notification_setting to create a new
   Notification Setting.
 * Added a new endpoint GET /notification_setting/{id} to get a Notification
   Setting specified by the input id.
 * Added a new endpoint PATCH /notification_setting/{id} to update the values
   for a specified Notification Setting.
 * Added a new endpoint DELTE /notification_setting/{id} to delete a
   specified Notification Setting.
 * Introduced `POST /oracle/db/snapshot/{id}/export/tablespace` endpoint to
   trigger the export of a single tablespace in an Oracle database.
 * Added a new optional field 'shouldRestoreFilesOnly' to POST
   /oracle/db/snapshot/{id}/export endpoint, used when exporting an Oracle
   database, to specify whether the user requires a full recovery of the
   database or a restoration of the database files.
 * Added /oracle/hierarchy/{id}/children endpoint to get children of
   object in Oracle hierarchy
 * Added /oracle/hierarchy/{id}/descendants endpoint to get descendants of
   object in Oracle hierarchy
 * Added a new endpoint POST /fileset/{id}/unprotect, which can be used to
   unprotect a fileset and specify a retention policy to apply to existing
   snapshots.
 * Added a new optional field 'existingSnapshotRetention' to POST
   /sla_domain/{id}/assign, used when unprotecting an object, to specify whether
   to retain existing snapshots according to the current SLA domain, keep
   existing snapshots forever, or expire all snapshots immediately. If not
   specified, this field will default to the existing behavior of keeping
   snapshots forever.
 * Introduced `GET /kmip/client` endpoint to get the stored KMIP client
   configuration.
 * Introduced `PUT /kmip/client` endpoint to set the KMIP client configuration.
 * Introduced `GET /kmip/server` endpoint to get stored KMIP server
   information.
 * Introduced `PUT /kmip/server` endpoint to add a a KMIP server.
 * Introduced `DELETE /kmip/server` endpoint to remove a a KMIP server.
 * Introduced `POST /session` endpoint to generate session tokens.
 * Added a new optional field 'mfaServerId' to /user endpoint for
   associating a configured MFA server.
 * Added REST support for Oracle RAC, Oracle Host.
   Updated the detail and summary for Oracle Database.
 * Added support to run on-demand backup jobs, export snapshots, live
   mount for Oracle Database.
 * Introduced `POST /mfa/rsa/server` endpoint to
   create a new RSA server configuration for MFA integration.
 * Introduced `GET /mfa/rsa/server` endpoint to
   get a list of RSA server configured for MFA integration.
 * Introduced `PATCH /mfa/rsa/server/{id}` endpoint to
   modify RSA server configuration.
 * Introduced `GET /mfa/rsa/server/{id}` endpoint to
   get RSA server configuration.
 * Introduced `POST /mfa/initialize` to initialize an attempt
   to perform Multifactor authentication for a user.
 * Introduced `POST /mfa/session` to perform Multifactor
   authentication for a user.
 * Introduced `POST /session/api_token` to create an API Token.
 * Added a new optional field 'isArrayEnabled' to 'FilesetTemplateCreate'
   for creation of storage array-enabled fileset templates. We also include
   this new field in 'FilesetTemplateDetail'.
 * Added a new optional field 'arraySpec' to 'FilesetCreate' for
   creation of storage array-enabled filesets. We also include
   this new field in 'FilesetSummary' and 'FilesetDetail'.
 * Introduced `GET /cluster/{id}/is_azure_cloud_only` to query if the cluster
   supports only Azure public cloud.
 * Introduced `POST /unmanaged_object/assign_retention_sla` to set Retention
   SLA of unmanaged objects.
 * Introduced `POST /unmanaged_object/snapshot/assign_sla` to set Retention
   SLA of unmanaged snapshots.
 * Introduced `POST /mssql/db/bulk/snapshot/{id}` to take an on-demand snapshot
   of multiple SQL Server databases. The result of this asynchronous request
   can be obtained from `GET /mssql/db/bulk/snapshot/{id}`.
 * Added a new field unprotectable_reasons to GET /mssql/db/{id} and
   GET /mssql/instance/{id}. This field keeps track of the reasons that a
   SQL Server database or instance cannot be protected by Rubrik.
 * Introduced a new `GET /cluster/me/login_banner` and
   `PUT /cluster/me/login_banner` endpoints to get and set the banner
   that displays after each successful login.
 * Introduced a new `GET /cluster/me/security_classification` and
   `PUT /cluster/me/security_classification` endpoints to get and set
   the security classification banner for the cluster. The cluster UI
   displays the banner in the specified color.
 * Introduced `GET /cluster/{id}/security/rksupport_cred` to provide
   the status of the rksupport credentials.
 * Introduced  `POST /cluster/{id}/security/rksupport_cred` to update
   the cluster-wide credentials for the specified cluster.
 * Introduced `POST /vmware/vm/snapshot/{id}/mount_disks` to attach VMDKs
   from a mount snapshot to an existing virtual machine
 * Introduced new `GET /host/{id}/volume` endpoint to query the HostVolume
   from the host.
 * Added the `HostVolumeSummary`, which is the response of the endpoint
   `GET /host/{id}/volume` and a part of `VolumeGroupDetail`.
 * Introduced a new `GET /volume_group/host_layout/{snapshot_id}` and
   `GET /volume_group/{host_id}/host_layout` to get the Windows host layout
   of all disks and volumes.
 * Added `WindowsHostLayout` which is the response of
   `GET /volume_group/host_layout/{snapshot_id}` and
   `GET /volume_group/{host_id}/host_layout`.
 * Added support for App Blueprint.
 * Added new fields 'retentionSlaDomainId' and 'retentionSlaDomainName' to
   UnmanagedObjectSummary object, which is returned from a
   `GET /unmanaged_object` call.
 * Removed 'unmanagedSnapshotCount' and added new fields 'autoSnapshotCount'
   and 'manualSnapshotCount' to UnmanagedObjectSummary object, which is
   returned from a `GET /unmanaged_object` call.
 * Added new fields 'retentionSlaDomainId' and 'retentionSlaDomainName' to
   UnmanagedSnapshotSummary object, which is returned from a
   `GET /unmanaged_object/{id}/snapshot` call.
 * Added a new field 'hasAttachingDisk' to 'GET /vmware/vm/snapshot/mount' and
   'GET /vmware/vm/snapshot/mount/{id}' that indicates to the user whether
   this is an attaching disk mount job.
 * Added a new field 'attachingDiskCount' to 'GET /vmware/vm/snapshot/mount'
   and 'GET /vmware/vm/snapshot/mount/{id}' that indicate to the user how many
   disks are attached.
 * Added field 'RetentionSlaDomainName' to sort_by of a
   `GET * /unmanaged_object/{id}/snapshot` call.
 * Added field 'excludedDiskIds' to NutanixVmDetail which is returned from a
   'GET /nutanix/vm/{id}' to exclude certain disks from backup. Also added
   field to NutanixVmPatch via 'PATCH /nutanix/vm/{id}' to allow the field
   to be updated.
 * Introduced the `PATCH /aws/ec2_instance/indexing_state` endpoint for
   enabling/disabling indexing per EC2 instance.
 * Added new optional fields 'organizationId' and 'organizationName' to
   `/host/{id}` and `/host` endpoints to get the organization a host is
   assigned to due to Envoy.
 * Introduced a new `GET /host/envoy` endpoint. Acts similar to queryHost but
   also includes Envoy organization info if Envoy is enabled.
 * Added a new endpoint 'GET /vmware/vcenter/{id}/tag_category' to get a list of
   Tag Categories associated with a vCenter.
 * Added a new endpoint 'Get /vmware/vcenter/tag_category/{tag_category_id}' to
   get a specific Tag Category associated with a vCenter.
 * Added a new endpoint 'GET /vmware/vcenter/{id}/tag' to get a list of Tags
   associated with a vCenter. The optional category_id parameter allow the
   response to be filtered by Tag Category.
 * Added a new endpoint 'GET /vmware/vcenter/tag/{tag_id}' to get a
   specific Tag associated with a vCenter.
 * Introduced `GET /cluster/{id}/global_manager_connectivity` to
   retrieve a set of URLs that are pingable from the CDM cluster.
 * Added optional field `instanceName` in `ManagedObjectProperties`.
 * Added new endpoint GET `/cloud_on/aws/app_image/{id}` to retrieve a specified
   AWS AppBlueprint image.
 * Added new endpoint DELETE `/cloud_on/aws/app_image/{id}` to delete the
   given AWS AppBlueprint image.
 * Added new endpoint GET `/cloud_on/azure/app_image/{id}` to retrieve a
   specified Azure AppBlueprint image.
 * Added new endpoint DELETE `/cloud_on/azure/app_image/{id}` to delete the
   given Azure AppBlueprint image.
 * Added organization endpoint for Oracle.
 * Added new endpoint GET `/cloud_on/aws/app_image` to retrieve all
   AWS AppBlueprint images.
 * Added new endpoints `GET /stats/cloud_storage/physical`, `GET
   /stats/cloud_storage/ingested` and `GET /stats/cloud_storage/logical` which
   return respective stats aggregated across all archival locations
 * Added a new endpoint 'POST /vmware/standalone_host/datastore' to get a list
   of datastore names for a given ESXi host.
 * Added a new optional field 'apiEndpoint' to 'NasBaseConfig'.

 ### Changes to Internal API in Rubrik version 4.2
 ## Breaking changes:
 * Introduced a new `GET /cluster/{id}/trial_edge` for getting whether the
   cluster is a trial edge.
 * Moved the /auth_domain/ endpoint from internal APIs to the v1 APIs.
 * Deprecated `POST /archive/nfs/reconnect` endpoint. Use
   `POST /archive/nfs/reader/connect` instead to connect as a reader to an
   existing NFS archival location.
 * Deprecated `POST /archive/object_store/reconnect` endpoint. Use
   `POST /archive/object_store/reader/connect` instead to connect as a reader to
   an existing object store location.
 * Deprecated `POST /archive/qstar/reconnect` endpoint. Use
   `POST /archive/qstar/reader/connect` instead to connect as a reader to an
   existing QStar archival location.
 * Deprecated `POST /archive/dca/reconnect` endpoint. Use
   `POST /archive/dca/reader/connect` instead to connect as a reader to an
   existing DCA archival location.
 * Removed `POST /hyperv/vm/snapshot/{id}/restore_file` endpoint. Use
   `POST /hyperv/vm/snapshot/{id}/restore_files` instead to support
   multi-files restore for Hyper-V vm.
 * Removed `POST /nutanix/vm/snapshot/{id}/restore_file` endpoint. Use
   `POST /nutainx/vm/snapshot/{id}/restore_files` instead to support
   multi-files restore for Nutanix vm.
 * Removed `search_timezone_offset` parameter from
   `GET /unmanaged_object/{id}/snapshot` endpoint. The endpoint will now
   use configured timezone on the cluster.
 * Renamed the field `id` in `UserDefinition` to `username` for `POST /user`
   endpoint.
 * Removed the `/mssql/db/sla/{id}/availability_group_conflicts` endpoint.
 * Removed the `/mssql/db/sla/{id}/assign` endpoint.
 * Added support for Envoy VMs for Organization.
 * Modified the `DELETE /storage/array/{id}` endpoint so that it now triggers
   an asynchronous deletion job, responds with an async request object, and
   archives the storage array's hierarchy.
 * Added `numStorageArrayVolumeGroupsArchived` to `DataLocationUsage` which
   is the response of the `GET /stats/data_location/usage` endpoint.
 * Modified `POST /storage/array` endpoint so that it now triggers an
   asynchronous refresh job, and responds with an async request object.
 * Modified the `GET /storage/array/{id}` and `DELETE /storage/array/{id}`
   endpoints so that the `id` field now corresponds to the managed ID
   instead of the simple ID. The 'managed ID' is the ID assigned to the
   storage array object by the Rubrik REST API server.
 * Moved /throttle endpoint to /backup_throttle.
 * Introduced a new `EmailSubscriptionUpdate` object for the request of the
   `PATCH /report/email_subscription/{subscription_id}` endpoint.
 * Introduced a new `ReportSubscriptionOwner` object for the response of
   `GET /report/email_subscription/{subscription_id}` and
   `GET /report/{id}/email_subscription` endpoints.
 * Added the envoyStatus field to the response of the GET /organization
   endpoint.
 * Added new `attachments` field to the `POST /report/{id}/email_subscription`
   and `PATCH /report/email_subscription/{subscription_id}` endpoints.
 * Removed fields `length` and `isLog` in response of
   `/mssql/db/{id}/restore_files`.
 * Moved the `/cluster/decommissionNode` endpoint to
   `/cluster/decommissionNodes`. The `DecommissionNodeConfig` object is renamed
   as `DecommissionNodesConfig` and now takes in a list of strings which
   correspond to the IDs of the nodes that are to be decommissioned.
 * Moved the `POST /vmware/vm/{id}/register_agent` endpoint from internal
   APIs to the v1 APIs.
 * Added a required field for environment in AzureComputeSummary to support
   Azure Gov Cloud.
 * Remove `POST internal/vmware/vm/snapshot/{id}/mount` endpoint. Use public
   API of `POST v1/vmware/vm/snapshot/{id}/mount`
 * The input field OperatingSystemType value `Linux` is replaced by `UnixLike`
   in FilesetTemplateCreateDefinition, used by POST /fileset-template, and
   in FilesetTemplatePatchDefinition, used by PATCH /fileset_template/{id}.
 * The input field operating_system_type value `Linux` is replaced by `UnixLike`
   in GET /host-fileset and GET /host-count.
 * Added 'snmpAgentPort' field to SnmpConfig object.

 ## Feature Additions/improvements:
 * Introduced the `GET /node_management/default_gateway` and `POST
   /node_management/default_gateway` endpoint to get and set default gateway.
 * Introduced the `GET cloud_on/aws/instance_type_list` and `GET
   cloud_on/azure/instance_type_list` endpoint to fetch list of instance types
   for aws and azures.
 * Introduced the `GET /aws/account/{id}/subnet` endpoint to fetch an
   information summary for each of the subnets available in an AWS account.
 * Introduced the `GET /aws/account/{id}/security_group` endpoint to fetch an
   information summary for each of the security groups belonging to a particular
   virtual network in an AWS account.
 * Moved definitions `Subnet` and `SecurityGroup` of `definitions/cloud_on.yml`
   to `definitions/cloud_common.yml` so that both the CloudOn and CloudNative
   features can use them.
 * Introduced the `GET /host/{id}/diagnose` endpoint to support target host
   diagnosis features. Network connectivity (machine/agent ping) implemented
   in the current version.
 * Added vCD endpoints to support vCloud Director. The following endpoints
   have been added to the vcdCluster object:
   - `POST /vcd/cluster` to add a new vCD cluster object.
 * Added support for CRUD operations on vCloud Director cluster objects.
   - POST /vcd/cluster, PATCH /vcd/cluster/{id}, DELETE /vcd/cluster/{id},
     POST /vcd/cluster/{id}/refresh are the endpoints for adding, editing,
     deleting and refreshing a vCD cluster object respectively.
 * Introduced endpoint `GET /search/snapshot_search` to search files in a
   given snapshot. The search supports prefix search only.
 * Introduced the new `POST /storage/array/{id}/refresh` endpoint to
   create a new refresh job to update the Storage Array metadata.
 * Introduced the new `GET /storage/array/request/{id}` endpoint to
   get status of a storage array-related asynchronous request.
 * Introduced the new `POST /storage/array/volume/group` endpoint
   to add a new storage array volume group.
 * Introduced the new `GET /storage/array/volume/group/{id}` endpoint
   to get details of a storage array volume group.
 * Introduced the new `DELETE /storage/array/volume/group/{id}` endpoint
   to remove a storage array volume group.
 * Introduced the new `GET /storage/array/hierarchy/{id}` endpoint
   to get a summary of an object in the storage array hierarchy.
 * Introduced the new `GET /storage/array/hierarchy/{id}/children` endpoint
   to get the children of an object in the storage array hierarchy.
 * Introduced the new `GET /storage/array/hierarchy/{id}/descendants` endpoint
   to get the descendants of an object in the storage array hierarchy.
 * Introduced the new `GET /storage/array/volume` endpoint to get
   summary information of all storage array volumes.
 * Introduced the new `GET /storage/array/volume/{id}` endpoint to get
   details of a storage array volume.
 * Introduced the new `POST /storage/array/volume/group/{id}/snapshot`
   endpoint to create a new on-demand backup job for a storage array
   volume group.
 * Introduced the new `PATCH /storage/array/volume/group/{id}` endpoint to
   update the properties of a storage array volume group object.
 * Introduced the new `GET /storage/array/volume/group` endpoint to
   get all storage array volume groups subject to specified filters.
 * Introduced endpoint `POST /archive/location/{id}/owner/pause` to pause
   archiving to a given archival location that is owned by the current cluster.
 * Introduced endpoint `POST /archive/location/{id}/owner/resume` to resume
   archiving to a given archival location that is owned by the current cluster.
 * Introduced endpoint `POST /archive/location/{id}/reader/promote` to promote
   the current cluster to be the owner of a specified archival location that is
   currently connected as a reader location.
 * Introduced endpoint `POST /archive/location/{id}/reader/refresh` to sync the
   current reader cluster with the contents on the archival location. This pulls
   in any changes made by the owner cluster to the archival location since the
   last time the current cluster was synced.
 * Introduced endpoint `POST /archive/dca/reader/connect` to connect as a reader
   to a DCA archival location.
 * Introduced endpoint `POST /archive/nfs/reader/connect` to connect as a reader
   to an NFS archival location.
 * Introduced endpoint `POST /archive/object_store/reader/connect` to connect as
   a reader to an object store location.
 * Introduced endpoint `POST /archive/dca/qstar/connect` to connect as a reader
   to a QStar archival location.
 * Updated `ArchivalLocationSummary` returned by `GET /archive/location`
   endpoint to include `ownershipStatus` field, to indicate whether the current
   cluster is connected to the archival location as an owner (active or paused),
   as a reader, or if the archival location is deleted.
 * Added the `ca_certs` field to `StorageArrayDefinition` to allow admins
   to specify certificates used for validation when making network
   requests to the storage array API service. This effects endpoints
   `POST /storage/array`, `GET /storage/array/{id}`, and
   `PUT /storage/array/{id}`.
 * Introduced the `POST /vmware/vm/snapshot/{id}/download_files` endpoint to
   download multiple files/folders from a given vm snapshot. The URL to
   download the zip file including the files will be presented to the users.
 * Introduced the `POST /fileset/snapshot/{id}/download_files` endpoint to
   download multiple files/folders from a given fileset snapshot. The URL to
   download the zip file including the specific files/folders will be presented
   to the users.
 * Introduced the `POST /nutanix/vm/snapshot/{id}/download_files` endpoint to
   download multiple files/folders from a given nutanix snapshot. The URL to
   download the zip file including the specific files/folders will be presented
   to the users.
 * Removed the `POST /nutanix/vm/snapshot/{id}/download_file` endpoint as
   downloading a single file/folder from the nutanix backup is just a special
   case of downloading multiple files/folders.
 * Introduced the `POST /hyperv/snapshot/{id}/download_files` endpoint to
   download multiple files/folders from a given Hyper-V snapshot. The URL to
   download the zip file including the specific files/folders will be presented
   to the users.
 * Introduced the POST /managed_volume/snapshot/{id}/download_files endpoint
   to download multiple files and/or folders from a given managed volume
   snapshot. This endpoint returns the URL to download the ZIP file that
   contains the specified files and/or folders.
 * Introduced the new `GET /storage/array/volume/group/{id}/search` endpoint to
   search storage array volume group for a file.
 * Introduced the new `GET /storage/array/volume/group/snapshot/{id}`
   endpoint to retrieve details of a storage array volume group snapshot.
 * Introduced the new `DELETE /storage/array/volume/group/snapshot/{id}`
   endpoint to remove a storage array volume group snapshot.
 * Introduced the new `DELETE /storage/array/volume/group/{id}` endpoint
   to delete all snapshots of a storage array volume group.
 * Introduced the new `POST /storage/array/volume/group/{id}/download`
   endpoint to download a storage array volume group snapshot from archival.
 * Introduced new `GET/storage/array/volume/group/snapshot/{id}/restore_files`
   endpoint to restore files from snapshot of a storage array volume group.
 * Added storage volume endpoints for AWS cloud native workload protection.
   Endpoints added:
   - GET /aws/ec2_instance/{id}/storage_volume/ to retrieve
     all storage volumes details attached to an ec2 instance object.
   - GET /aws/ec2_instance/{ec2_instance_id}/storage_volume/{id} to retrieve
     details of a storage volume attached to an ec2 instance object.
   - POST /aws/ec2_intance/snapshot/{id}/export to export the snapshot of
     an ec2 instance object to a new ec2 instance object.
 * Introduced the new `POST /storage/array/volume/group/{id}/download_file`
   endpoint to download a file from an archived storage array volume group
   snapshot.
 * Introduced the new `GET /storage/array/volume/group/{id}/missed_snapshot`
   endpoint to get details about all missed snapshots of a storage array volume
   group.
 * Introduced the `GET /network_throttle` endpoint for retrieving the list of
   network throttles.
 * Introduced the `PATCH /network_throttle/{id}` endpoint for updating
   network throttles.
 * Introduced the new `GET /storage/array/host/{id}` endpoint to get details
   about all storage array volumes connected to a host.
 * Introduced the `GET /organization/{id}/storage/array` endpoint for getting
   information for authorized storage array resources in an organization.
 * Introduced the `GET /organization/{id}/storage/array/volume_group/metric`
   endpoint for getting storage array volume groups metrics in an
   organization.
 * Introduced the new POST /vmware/vm/snapshot/mount/{id}/rollback endpoint to
   rollback the datastore used by a virtual machine, after an Instant Recovery
   that used the preserve MOID setting. This endpoint 'rolls back' the
   recovered virtual machine's datastore from the Rubrik cluster to the
   original datastore.
 * Added `owner` and `status` fields to the `EmailSubscriptionSummary`
   object used in responses for many `/report/{id}/email_subscription`
   and `/report/email_subscription/{subscription_id}` endpoints.
 * Added `availableSpace` and `readerLocationSummary` fields to the
   `NfsLocationDetail` object used in responses for `/archive/nfs` and
   `/archive/nfs/{id}` endpoints.
 * Added `availableSpace` and `readerLocationSummary` fields to the
   `QstarLocationSummary` object used in responses for the `/archive/qstar`
   endpoint.
 * Added `availableSpace` and `readerLocationSummary` fields to the
   `QstarLocationDetail` object used in responses for the `/archive/qstar/{id}`
   endpoint.
 * Added `readerLocationSummary` field to the `ObjectStoreLocationDetail`
   object used in responses for the `/archive/object_store` and
   `/archive/object_store/{id}` endpoints.
 * Added `readerLocationSummary` field to the `DcaLocationDetail` object
   used in responses for the `/archive/dca` and `/archive/dca/{id}` endpoints.
 * Added a new field `guestOsType` to `HypervVirtualMachineDetail`
   object used in response of `GET /hyperv/vm/{id}`
 * Added a new field `guestOsType` to `VirtualMachineDetail`
   object referred by `VappVmDetail`
 * Added new field `fileType` in response of `/mssql/db/{id}/restore_files`.
 * Added an optional field `agentStatus` to `VirtualMachineSummary` object used
   in response of `GET /vmware/vm` endpoint. This allows user to check the
   Rubrik Backup Service connection status of the corresponding VMware VM.
 * Introduced the new `POST /fileset/snapshot/{id}/export_files` endpoint to
   export multiple files or directories to destination host.
 * Introduced the new `GET /vmware/config/esx_subnets` endpoint to get the
   the preferred subnets to reach ESX hosts.
 * Introduced the new `PATCH /vmware/config/reset_esx_subnets` endpoint to
   reset the preferred subnets to reach ESX hosts.
 * Changed the `PATCH /vmware/config/reset_esx_subnets` endpoint to
   `PATCH /vmware/config/set_esx_subnets`
 * Removed the `needsInspection` field from the NodeStatus object returned in
   the `/cluster/{id}/node` and `/node` endpoints.
 * Introduced the new `PATCH /auth_domain/{id}` endpoint to update the Active
   Directory configuration parameters.
 * Introduced the new `GET /cluster/{id}/auto_removed_node` endpoint to
   query for unacknowledged automatic node removals by the Rubrik cluster.
 * Introduced the new
   `DELETE /cluster/{id}/auto_removed_node/{node_id}/acknowledge` endpoint to
   acknowledge an automatic node removal.
 * Introduced the new `GET /cluster/{id}/system_status` endpoint to retrieve
   information about the status of the Rubrik cluster.
 * Changed the `POST /cloud_on/azure/subscription` endpoint to to take
   the parameter `AzureSubscriptionRequest` instead of
   `AzureSubscriptionCredential` in body.
 * Changed the `POST /cloud_on/azure/storage_account` endpoint to to take
   the parameter `AzureStorageAccountRequest` instead of
   `AzureStorageAccountCredential` in body.
 * Changed the `POST /cloud_on/azure/resource_group` endpoint to take
   the parameter `AzureResourceGroupRequest` instead of
   `AzureResourceGroupCredential` in body.
 * Added a `reportTemplate` field to the response of both the
   `GET /report/{id}/table` and `GET /report/{id}/chart` endpoints.

 ### Changes to Internal API in Rubrik version 4.1
 ## Changes to support instance from image
 * POST /aws/instance and /azure/instance was supported only from a Rubrik
   snapshot. Now it is changed to support instantiation from Rubrik snapshot as
   well as pre-existing image. Rest end point is same, we just changed the
   CreateCloudInstanceRequest object type.
 * Add a new field 'ignoreErrors' to POST /vmware/vm/snapshot/{id}/restore_files
   that will let job restore ignore file errors during restore job.
 ## Breaking changes:
 * None is removed as a Nutanix snapshot consistency mandate so it is no
   longer valid in GET /nutanix/vm, GET /nutanix/vm/{id}, and
   PATCH /nutanix/vm/{id}.
 * computeSecurityGroupId is replaced by the object defaultComputeNetworkConfig
   in ObjectStoreLocationSummary ,ObjectStoreUpdateDefinition and
   ObjectStoreReconnectDefinition which are used by
   GET /archive/object_store/{id}, PATCH /archive/object_store/{id} and
   POST /archive/object_store/reconnect respectively.
 * The PUT /throttle endpoint was changed to provide configuration for
   Hyper-V adaptive throttling. Three parameters were added:
   hypervHostIoLatencyThreshold, hypervHostCpuUtilizationThreshold, and
   hypervVmCpuUtilizationThreshold. To differentiate between the multiple
   hypervisors, the existing configuration parameters for VMware were renamed
   VmwareVmIoLatencyThreshold, VmwareDatastoreIoLatencyThreshold and
   VmwareCpuUtilizationThreshold. These changes also required modifications
   and additions to the GET /throttle endpoint.
 * For `POST /cluster/{id}/node` endpoint, it gets now `AddNodesConfig` in body
   instead of `Map_NodeConfig` directly.
 * For `POST /node_management/replace_node` endpoint, added the `ipmiPassword`
   field to the `ReplaceNodeConfig` object.
 * For `POST /stats/system_storage` endpoint, added the miscellaneous, liveMount
   and snapshot field to `SystemStorageStats` object.
 * For `POST /principal_search`, removed `managedId` field from the
   `PrincipalSummary` object and changed the `id` field of the
   `PrincipalSummary` object to correspond to the managed id instead of the
   simple id.
 * For `GET /cluster/{id}/timezone` and `PATCH /cluster/{id}/timezone`, the
   functionality has merged into `GET /cluster/{id}` and `PATCH /cluster/{id}`
   in v1.
 * Removed the `GET /cluster/{id}/decommissionNodeStatus` endpoint.
   Decommission status is now available through queries of the `jobId` that is
   returned by a decommission request. Queries can be performed at the
   `GET /job/{id}` endpoint.
 * For `GET /api/internal/managed_volume/?name=<name>`, the name match is now
   exact instead of infix
 * Updated the list of available attribute and measure values for the `chart0`
   and `chart1` parameters for the `PATCH /report/{id}` endpoint.
 * Updated the list of available column values for the `table` parameter for the
   `PATCH /report/{id}` endpoint.
 * Updated the `FolderHierarchy` response object to include
   `effectiveSlaDomainId`, `effectiveSlaDomainName`,
   `effectiveSlaSourceObjectId`, and `effectiveSlaSourceObjectName`.

 ## Feature Additions/improvements:
 * Added the field `pendingSnapshotCount` to ManagedVolumeSummary and
   ManagedVolumeDetail objects used in responses for endpoints
   `GET /managed_volume`, `POST /managed_volume`, `GET /managed_volume/{id}`,
   `PATCH /managed_volume/{id}`, `GET /organization/{id}/managed_volume`.
 * Introduced the `GET /managed_volume/snapshot/export/{id}` endpoint
   to retrieve details of a specific managed volume snapshot export.
 * Added the 'name' filter for GET requests on the /replication/target endpoint.
   This filter allows users to filter results based on the name of a
   replication target.
 * Added the 'name' filter for GET requests on the /archive/location endpoint.
   This filter allows users to filter results based on the name of an
   archival location.
 * Added new fields 'replicas' and 'availabilityGroupId' on GET /mssql
   and GET /mssql/{id}. If a database is an availability database,
   it will have some number of replicas, which are copies of the database
   running on different instances. Otherwise, there will only be one
   replica, which represents the single copy of the database. The field
   'availabilityGroupId' will be set only for availability databases
   and points to the availability group of the database. Also deprecated
   several fields on these endpoints, as they should now be accessed via
   the 'replicas' field.
 * Added 'Cluster' notification type.
 * Added optional 'organizationId' parameter to to the grant/revoke and get
  authorization endpoints. This parameter can be used to
   grant/revoke/get authorizations with respect to a specific Organization.
 * Added endpoint to get/set whether the Rubrik Backup Service is automatically
   deployed to a guest OS.
 * Added cloudInstantiationSpec field to Hyper-V VM endpoint for configuring
   automatic cloud conversion
 * Introduced a new end point /cluster/{id}/platforminfo to GET information
   about the platform the current software is running on
 * Introduced the `GET /organization` and `GET /organization/{id}` endpoints
   for retrieving the list of organizations and a single organization.
 * Introduced the `POST /organization` endpoint for creating organizations,
   the `PATCH /organization/{id}` endpoint for updating organizations and the
   `DELETE /organization/{id}` endpoint for deleting organizations.
 * Introduced the `GET /organization/{id}/stats/storage_growth_timeseries`
   endpoint and the `GET /organization/{id}/stats/total_storage_usage` for
   getting Physical Storage Growth over Time and Total Physical Storage Usage
   on a per Organization basis.
 * Introduced a number of endpoints of the format
   `GET /organization/{id}/<resource-type>` for retrieving all the resources of
   the corresponding type in a given organization.
 * Introduced a number of endpoints of the format
   `GET /organization/{id}/<resource-type>/metric` for retrieving the protection
   counts of the resources of the corresponding type in a given organization.
 * Added the 'reportTemplate' filter for GET requests on the /report endpoint.
   This allows queried reports to be filtered and sorted by report template.
 * Introduced the `POST /cluster/{id}/security/password/strength` endpoint
   for assessing the strength of passwords during bootstrap through rkcli.
 * Added a new 'ipv6' field in the response of the `GET /cluster/{id}/discover`
   endpoint.
 * Added relatedIds field for EventSummary object to give more context about
   the event.
 * Added operatingSystemType field for NutanixSummary object. This field
   represents the type of operating system on the Nutanix virtual machine.

 ### Changes to Internal API in Rubrik version 4.0
 ## Breaking changes:
 * For `GET /unmanaged_object` endpoint, replaced the 'Fileset' of object_type
   filter with more specific object types: 'WindowsFileset', 'LinuxFileset' and
   'ShareFileset'. Also added filter value for additional unmanaged objects
   we now support.
 * For /mssql/db/{id}/compatible_instance added recoveryType as mandatory
   query parameter

 ## Feature Additions/improvements:
 * Added QStar end points to support it as an archival location. The location
   is always encrypted and an encryption password must be set while adding the
   location. End points added:
   - `DELETE /archive/qstar` to clean up the data in the bucket in the QStar
     archival location.
   - `GET /archive/qstar` to retrieve a summary of all QStar archival locations.
   - `POST /archive/qstar` to add a QStar archival location.
   - `POST /archive/qstar/reconnect` to reconnect to a specific QStar archival
     location.
   - `POST /archive/qstar/remove_bucket` to remove buckets matching a prefix
      from QStar archival location.
   - `GET /archive/qstar/{id}` to retrieve a summary information from a specific
     QStar archival location.
   - `PATCH /archive/qstar/{id}` to update a specific QStar archival location.
 * Added the 'name' filter for GET requests on the /archive/location endpoint.
   This filter allows users to filter results based on the name of an
   archival location.
 * Introduced an optional parameter `encryptionPassword` for the
   `/data_location/nfs` `POST` endpoint. This password is used for
   deriving the master key for encrypting the NFS archival location.
 * Introduced /managed\_volume, /managed\_volume/snapshot/export/{id},
   and other child endpoints for creating, deleting, and updating
   Managed Volumes and its exports and snapshots.
 * Added support for Hyper-V.
 * Add new /hierarchy endpoint to support universal hierarchy view.
 * Added support for Nutanix.
 * Moved and merged vCenter refresh status and delete status from independent
   internal endpoints to a single status field in v1 vCenter detail.
 * Added endpoint to get/set whether the Rubrik Backup Service is automatically
   deployed to a guest OS.
 * Introduced an optional parameter `minTolerableNodeFailures` for the
   `/cluster/decommissionNode` `POST` endpoint. This parameter specifies the
   minimum fault tolerance to node failures that must exist when a node is
   decommissioned.
 * Added `nodeId` to `AsyncRequestStatus` to improve debugging job failures.

 ### Changes to Internal API in Rubrik version 3.2.0
 ## Breaking changes:
 * Introduced endpoint /host/share/id/search to search for
   files on the network share.
 * Introduced endpoints /host/share and /host/share/id to
   support native network shares under /host endpoint.
 * For /unmanaged_object endpoints, change sort_attr to sort_by
   sort_attr used to accept a comma separated list of column names to sort.
   Now sort_by only accepts a single column name.
 * For /unmanaged_object endpoints, removed the need for object type when
   deleting unmanaged objects and its snapshots.

 ## Feature Additions/improvements:
 * Added internal local_<component> end points. These are used for
   handling operations on per-node auto-scaling config values.
   Please see src/spec/local-config/comments for details.
 * For the response of /mssql/db/{id}/restore_files, added two more fields
   for each file object. They are the original file name and file length
   of the file to be restore.
 * Introduced a new end point /cluster/{id}/is_registered to GET registration
   status. With this change, we can query if the cluster is registered in the
   Rubrik customer database.
 * Introduced a new end point /cluster/{id}/registration_details to POST
   registration details. Customers are expected to get the registration details
   from the support portal. On successful submission of registration details
   with a valid registration id, the cluster will mark itself as registered.
 * For the /mssql/instance/{id} end point, added fields configuredSlaDomainId,
   configuredSlaDomainName, logBackupFrequencyInSeconds, logRetentionHours,
   and copyOnly.
 * Introduced optional parameter keepMacAddresses to
   POST /vmware/vm/snapshot/{id}/mount, /vmware/vm/snapshot/{id}/export, and
   /vmware/vm/snapshot/{id}/instant_recovery endpints.
   This allows new VMs to have the same MAC address as their source VMs.

 ## Bug fixes:
 * Made path parameter required in GET /browse. Previously, an error was
   thrown when path wasn't passed in. This solves that bug.

item.name: fileset_template
Create fileset templates.

body.raw: Provide an array containing a separate object for each fileset template definition.

request.description:
Create fileset templates. The template is applied to the host.  Each template is a set of paths on the host.

A template uses full paths and wildcards to define the objects to include, exclude, and exempt from exclusion.

The **_exceptions_** value specifies paths that should not be excluded from the fileset by the **_exclude_** value.

Specify an array of full path descriptions for each property **_include_**, **_exclude_**, and **_exceptions_**.

Acceptable wildcard characters are
+ **_\*_** Single asterisk matches zero or more characters up to a path deliminator
+ **_\*\*_** Double asterisk matches zero or more characters

The following rules apply to path descriptions
+ Accepts UTF-8 characters
+ Case sensitive
+ Forward slash character **_/_** is the path deliminator
+ Symbolic links must point to a subset of a non symbolic link path
+ Paths that do not start with **_/_** are modified to start with **_\*\*/_**
+ Paths that do not end with **_\*_** are modified to end with **_/\*\*_**
